                                                                                          <!-- element: headline -->
    <h1>UAE: Feeling dizzy while driving? This could be the reason</h1>
  

								
																								
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                        

								
																								
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: preamble -->
    <h3 class="preamble-nf">He hopes that this will raise awareness about the disease and help other doctors recognise its signs</h3>
  

								
																								
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                                                          
<hr class="gray-line vuukle-far-nf">

<div class="vuukle-powerbar-9C9225B5-AF9C-44BF-B706-2566B205F12F"></div>

<hr class="gray-line vuukle-far-nf">                                                						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                                                     <!-- object: image -->
    <div class="image-wrapper image-wrapper-first">
    <div class="article-lead-img-pan">
                                  <img class="img-fluid lazyload"
               srcset="https://image.khaleejtimes.com?uuid=ef2b74b2-d582-4757-a823-d78a878ed176&function=cropresize&type=preview&source=false&q=75&crop_w=0.99829&crop_h=0.99999&x=0.00085&y=0&width=300&height=169 300w,https://image.khaleejtimes.com?uuid=ef2b74b2-d582-4757-a823-d78a878ed176&function=cropresize&type=preview&source=false&q=75&crop_w=0.99829&crop_h=0.99999&x=0.00085&y=0&width=600&height=338 600w,https://image.khaleejtimes.com?uuid=ef2b74b2-d582-4757-a823-d78a878ed176&function=cropresize&type=preview&source=false&q=75&crop_w=0.99829&crop_h=0.99999&x=0.00085&y=0&width=900&height=506 900w,https://image.khaleejtimes.com?uuid=ef2b74b2-d582-4757-a823-d78a878ed176&function=cropresize&type=preview&source=false&q=75&crop_w=0.99829&crop_h=0.99999&x=0.00085&y=0&width=1200&height=675 1200w,https://image.khaleejtimes.com?uuid=ef2b74b2-d582-4757-a823-d78a878ed176&function=cropresize&type=preview&source=false&q=75&crop_w=0.99829&crop_h=0.99999&x=0.00085&y=0&width=1500&height=844 1500w"
               src="https://image.khaleejtimes.com?uuid=ef2b74b2-d582-4757-a823-d78a878ed176&function=cropresize&type=preview&source=false&q=75&crop_w=0.99829&crop_h=0.99999&x=0.00085&y=0&width=1200&height=675" style="width: 100%; height: auto;" height="438" width="780"
               alt="">
             </div>
    <div class="article-lead-img-caption">
      
    </div>
  </div>

                             						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                                                          <div class="row">
  <div class="col-lg-12">
    <div class="article-top-author-nw-nf">
              <div class="article-top-author-nw-nf-left">
                                    <!-- <a href="#"><img src="images/author-pic2.jpg" /></a> images/vuukle-social.jpg-->
                                            by <a href="/nasreen-abdulla"><h3>Nasreen Abdulla</h3></a>
                                              <!--<span>Dubai</span></h3>-->
        </div>
            <div class="article-top-author-nw-nf-right">
        <p><span>Published:</span> Mon 5 Jun 2023, 6:00 AM</p>
  <p><span>Last updated:</span> Mon 5 Jun 2023, 3:11 PM</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>                                                						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>For 46-year-old R.V., his job as a sales manager requires him to drive for hundreds of kilometres every week to meet clients.</p>
  

								
																								
								
                                                                                                                                                                      						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>However, when he started developing dizziness, palpitation and body stiffness while driving, his entire career was at stake. With over 22 years of experience on the roads, the man was at a loss as to why he would get these symptoms every day when he drove.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                            <!-- <div style="max-width:300px; margin: 0px auto!important;">
                                   
                                </div> -->
								
                                                        						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>A visit to neurologist Dr. Vishal Pawar at the Vertigo Clinic in Aster Clinic, Discovery Gardens, Dubai, revealed that R.V. was suffering from an under-reported condition called Motorist’s Vestibular Disorientation Syndrome (MVDS). First reported in 1985 when a paper was written on it, MVDS has since been largely forgotten with very little literature about it – the disease often gets misdiagnosed.</p>
  

								
																						 																<!-- googleoff: index -->
								<div id="adsolut-article"></div>
								<!-- googleon: index -->
																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>Dr. Vishal, who has been diligently monitoring patients for the last four years at the vertigo clinic, said that he started noticing a pattern in many of his patients. “Many experienced palpitations, dizziness, stiffness and other symptoms while driving,” he said.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>“Curiously, none of them were new drivers. They had been driving for at least five years before they experienced these issues. That is when I realized that they were showing classic symptoms of MVDS.”</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>Now, Dr. Vishal is preparing to publish a paper with case studies of over 24 patients who have been diagnosed with MVDS in the last 4 years. He hopes that this will raise awareness about the disease and help other doctors recognise the signs of the disease. He said that some of his patients had consulted up to eight doctors who had not been able to diagnose their issue.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: subheadline1 -->
    <h2>Common characteristics</h2>
  

								
																								
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>Dr. Vishal said that many of his patients had reported common characteristics. “Most of them developed symptoms at higher speed of 80 kmph or more,” he said. “They also developed these issues at bends and turns or on multi lane roads, especially on the high-speed lane. Many also exhibited symptoms on upward or downward slopes or when overtaking big vehicles.”</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>According to Dr. Vishal, part of the problem arises when the brain is not coordinated enough to perform all the functions necessary to drive.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>“Driving is a complex cognitive skill that is learnt,” he said. “The nature of driving especially in the UAE is very dynamic, with wide highways and high speeds. A variety of parts of the brain are involved in driving. We need higher cognitive function, we need to know where we are heading, memory, vision, power, sensory system and use our cerebellum.”</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>He said that when patients feel discomfort, they try to compensate. “When the patients feel dizzy or disoriented when driving, they try to make postural adjustments. When that doesn’t work, then they start to panic. Many of them often have to pull over and relax for a while before they can continue on with their journey.”</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: subheadline1 -->
    <h2>Treatment</h2>
  

								
																								
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>For R.V., his treatment involved taking prescribed medication, supplemented by vestibular physiotherapy with virtual reality goggles. He also received counselling from a psychologist. Over the course of 2 years, he experienced significant improvement in his symptoms, allowing him to drive without any issues.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>Dr. Vishal said that in most cases a combination of drugs, counselling and rehabilitation including playing car simulation games often helped his patients to recover and continue driving without issues.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p>Although there is no indication of what brings the onset of MVDS, Dr. Vishal said that more that pre-existing conditions like anxiety, migraine and motion sickness had some role to play in several of his case studies.</p>
  

								
																						 																
								
                                                                                                            						
                        
                                                                        						
                                    				 				
                    						
                                                                          						

                                                                        
                                                                                          <!-- element: body -->
    <p><strong id="strong-becc06ba57079f54e21450f469541bbd">ALSO READ:</strong></p>

processed_data.title: UAE: Feeling dizzy while driving? This could be the reason
processed_data.author: Nasreen Abdulla
processed_data.raw_text: Khansaheb Group firm supports Art Connects Women For 46-year-old R.V., his job as a sales manager requires him to drive for hundreds of kilometres every week to meet clients.  However, when he started developing dizziness, palpitation and body stiffness while driving, his entire career was at stake. With over 22 years of experience on the roads, the man was at a loss as to why he would get these symptoms every day when he drove.  A visit to neurologist Dr. Vishal Pawar at the Vertigo Clinic in Aster Clinic, Discovery Gardens, Dubai, revealed that R.V. was suffering from an under-reported condition called Motorist’s Vestibular Disorientation Syndrome (MVDS). First reported in 1985 when a paper was written on it, MVDS has since been largely forgotten with very little literature about it – the disease often gets misdiagnosed.  Dr. Vishal, who has been diligently monitoring patients for the last four years at the vertigo clinic, said that he started noticing a pattern in many of his patients. “Many experienced palpitations, dizziness, stiffness and other symptoms while driving,” he said.  “Curiously, none of them were new drivers. They had been driving for at least five years before they experienced these issues. That is when I realized that they were showing classic symptoms of MVDS.”  Now, Dr. Vishal is preparing to publish a paper with case studies of over 24 patients who have been diagnosed with MVDS in the last 4 years. He hopes that this will raise awareness about the disease and help other doctors recognise the signs of the disease. He said that some of his patients had consulted up to eight doctors who had not been able to diagnose their issue.  Dr. Vishal said that many of his patients had reported common characteristics. “Most of them developed symptoms at higher speed of 80 kmph or more,” he said. “They also developed these issues at bends and turns or on multi lane roads, especially on the high-speed lane. Many also exhibited symptoms on upward or downward slopes or when overtaking big vehicles.”  According to Dr. Vishal, part of the problem arises when the brain is not coordinated enough to perform all the functions necessary to drive.  “Driving is a complex cognitive skill that is learnt,” he said. “The nature of driving especially in the UAE is very dynamic, with wide highways and high speeds. A variety of parts of the brain are involved in driving. We need higher cognitive function, we need to know where we are heading, memory, vision, power, sensory system and use our cerebellum.”  He said that when patients feel discomfort, they try to compensate. “When the patients feel dizzy or disoriented when driving, they try to make postural adjustments. When that doesn’t work, then they start to panic. Many of them often have to pull over and relax for a while before they can continue on with their journey.”  For R.V., his treatment involved taking prescribed medication, supplemented by vestibular physiotherapy with virtual reality goggles. He also received counselling from a psychologist. Over the course of 2 years, he experienced significant improvement in his symptoms, allowing him to drive without any issues.  Dr. Vishal said that in most cases a combination of drugs, counselling and rehabilitation including playing car simulation games often helped his patients to recover and continue driving without issues.  Although there is no indication of what brings the onset of MVDS, Dr. Vishal said that more that pre-existing conditions like anxiety, migraine and motion sickness had some role to play in several of his case studies.  ALSO READ:  Khansaheb Group firm supports Art Connects Women The mall had first announced its new name in January this year via a TikTok video The toxic gas is particularly dangerous due to the fact that it is odourless and colourless, and thus difficult to detect Lovesy Mole Achamma, a resident of the Emirates for 21 years, is currently employed at a hospital in the capital Weekly draw saw 1,017 winners take home Dh1,448,250 in prize money Abdulrahman Mohammed Al Maamari shares his pride of Emirati heritage as he soars through the skies wearing traditional dress Other UAE leaders have also expressed their sorrow on the tragic incident He tweets in three languages — Arabic, English, and Hindi — and says the UAE people's thoughts are with the victims, Indian PM Modi
processed_data.text:
Khansaheb Group firm supports Art Connects Women
For 46-year-old R.V., his job as a sales manager requires him to drive for hundreds of kilometres every week to meet clients.
However, when he started developing dizziness, palpitation and body stiffness while driving, his entire career was at stake. With over 22 years of experience on the roads, the man was at a loss as to why he would get these symptoms every day when he drove.
A visit to neurologist Dr. Vishal Pawar at the Vertigo Clinic in Aster Clinic, Discovery Gardens, Dubai, revealed that R.V. was suffering from an under-reported condition called Motorist’s Vestibular Disorientation Syndrome (MVDS). First reported in 1985 when a paper was written on it, MVDS has since been largely forgotten with very little literature about it – the disease often gets misdiagnosed.
Dr. Vishal, who has been diligently monitoring patients for the last four years at the vertigo clinic, said that he started noticing a pattern in many of his patients. “Many experienced palpitations, dizziness, stiffness and other symptoms while driving,” he said.
“Curiously, none of them were new drivers. They had been driving for at least five years before they experienced these issues. That is when I realized that they were showing classic symptoms of MVDS.”
Now, Dr. Vishal is preparing to publish a paper with case studies of over 24 patients who have been diagnosed with MVDS in the last 4 years. He hopes that this will raise awareness about the disease and help other doctors recognise the signs of the disease. He said that some of his patients had consulted up to eight doctors who had not been able to diagnose their issue.
Dr. Vishal said that many of his patients had reported common characteristics. “Most of them developed symptoms at higher speed of 80 kmph or more,” he said. “They also developed these issues at bends and turns or on multi lane roads, especially on the high-speed lane. Many also exhibited symptoms on upward or downward slopes or when overtaking big vehicles.”
According to Dr. Vishal, part of the problem arises when the brain is not coordinated enough to perform all the functions necessary to drive.
“Driving is a complex cognitive skill that is learnt,” he said. “The nature of driving especially in the UAE is very dynamic, with wide highways and high speeds. A variety of parts of the brain are involved in driving. We need higher cognitive function, we need to know where we are heading, memory, vision, power, sensory system and use our cerebellum.”
He said that when patients feel discomfort, they try to compensate. “When the patients feel dizzy or disoriented when driving, they try to make postural adjustments. When that doesn’t work, then they start to panic. Many of them often have to pull over and relax for a while before they can continue on with their journey.”
For R.V., his treatment involved taking prescribed medication, supplemented by vestibular physiotherapy with virtual reality goggles. He also received counselling from a psychologist. Over the course of 2 years, he experienced significant improvement in his symptoms, allowing him to drive without any issues.
Dr. Vishal said that in most cases a combination of drugs, counselling and rehabilitation including playing car simulation games often helped his patients to recover and continue driving without issues.
Although there is no indication of what brings the onset of MVDS, Dr. Vishal said that more that pre-existing conditions like anxiety, migraine and motion sickness had some role to play in several of his case studies.

The toxic gas is particularly dangerous due to the fact that it is odourless and colourless, and thus difficult to detect

Abdulrahman Mohammed Al Maamari shares his pride of Emirati heritage as he soars through the skies wearing traditional dress
Other UAE leaders have also expressed their sorrow on the tragic incident
He tweets in three languages — Arabic, English, and Hindi — and says the UAE people's thoughts are with the victims, Indian PM Modi

  		jQuery.ajax({
				url: "https://api.khaleejtimes.com/home/decode_url",
				type: "POST",
				async: false,
				crossDomain: true,
				data: { "url" : urlz},
				 dataType: "jsonp",
    			jsonp: "jsoncallback",
				success:function(result){				  
					utag.link({
						"ad_platform":"AdManager",//Required example: AdManager
						"event_action":"addclick",       //Required

						"event_label":"Google",     //Required example google, facebook

						"ad_click_short":""+result.actual_url_2nd+"",
						"ad_click_full":""+result.actual_url+"",	
						"original_ad_link":""+result.clicked_url+""						
					});		
				},
				error:function(xhr,status,error,result){				
				   // alert(status);					
				}
			});	  
});

      var data = filter.find('select, input').serializeArray();

        // url: infomaker.ajaxurl,
        type: 'POST',
        data: data,
        dataType: 'JSON',
        beforeSend: function() {
          loader.show();
        },
        complete: function(){
          loader.hide();
        },
        success: function(response) {
          content.html(response.html);
          lazyLoadInstance.update();
        }
      });

            let dropdownArr = Array.from(dropdowns);
            dropdownArr.map((el) => {

                    el.classList.remove("show");
                }
            });
        }

processed_data.raw_text: UAE cloud adoption is three times higher than the Mena average UAE cloud adoption is three times higher than the Mena average Flagship laptops are for those who want a laptop that doesn't compromise on anything. What separates the flagship laptop from other good laptops is how it balances performance, efficiency, portability, and comfort. PARTNER CONTENT AI-enabled proptech firm sees transactions rise 46% this year The departure pointed to a fresh wave of turmoil among key officials at the company since Tesla boss took over last year Second edition of Dubai Esports and Games Festival to create a platform for gamers, investors, entrepreneurs, and international players Regulators around the world are scrambling to draw up rules governing use of generative AI, which can create text and images Federal Security Service says devices including those of domestic Russian subscribers as well as foreign diplomats have been compromised Wedding planners are increasingly using creative and interesting ways to incorporate tech into nuptials, making it a bespoke spectacle quite like none other Blue Logic sees AI gaining momentum in the country The action is in response to grievances received from users, violation of laws or terms of service, and orders received from the Grievance Appellate Committee
processed_data.text:
UAE cloud adoption is three times higher than the Mena average
UAE cloud adoption is three times higher than the Mena average
Flagship laptops are for those who want a laptop that doesn't compromise on anything. What separates the flagship laptop from other good laptops is how it balances performance, efficiency, portability, and comfort.
PARTNER CONTENT
AI-enabled proptech firm sees transactions rise 46% this year
The departure pointed to a fresh wave of turmoil among key officials at the company since Tesla boss took over last year
Second edition of Dubai Esports and Games Festival to create a platform for gamers, investors, entrepreneurs, and international players
Regulators around the world are scrambling to draw up rules governing use of generative AI, which can create text and images
Federal Security Service says devices including those of domestic Russian subscribers as well as foreign diplomats have been compromised
Wedding planners are increasingly using creative and interesting ways to incorporate tech into nuptials, making it a bespoke spectacle quite like none other
Blue Logic sees AI gaining momentum in the country
The action is in response to grievances received from users, violation of laws or terms of service, and orders received from the Grievance Appellate Committee

<script>
const getCookieValue = (name) => (
  document.cookie.match('(^|;)\\s*' + name + '\\s*=\\s*([^;]+)')?.pop() || ''
)
	
/*
	if(getCookieValue('user_sessions')%2==0)
	{    
	document.cookie = "user_sessions=1;path=/";	
	
	}
	else
	{
		var valuez=getCookieValue('user_sessions');
		if(!valuez)
		{		
		valuez=0;
		}
		value=Number(valuez)+1;
		document.cookie = "user_sessions="+ value+";path=/";
		
	}
*/

jQuery.noConflict();
jQuery(window).on('load', function() {
var iframe = jQuery("iframe");
console.log(iframe.contents());
/* use simple click */
iframe.contents().find("body").click(function(e) {
  var urlz=jQuery(this).contents().find("a").prop('href');
  		jQuery.ajax({
				url: "https://api.khaleejtimes.com/home/decode_url",
				type: "POST",
				async: false,
				crossDomain: true,
				data: { "url" : urlz},
				 dataType: "jsonp",
    			jsonp: "jsoncallback",
				success:function(result){				  
					utag.link({
						"ad_platform":"AdManager",//Required example: AdManager
						"event_action":"addclick",       //Required
						"event_category":"Paid Ad Click",  //Required example premium
						"event_label":"Google",     //Required example google, facebook   
						"tealium_event":"ad_click",        //Required
						"ad_click_short":""+result.actual_url_2nd+"",
						"ad_click_full":""+result.actual_url+"",	
						"original_ad_link":""+result.clicked_url+""						
					});		
				},
				error:function(xhr,status,error,result){				
				   // alert(status);					
				}
			});	  
});


jQuery("a").click(function(){
var linkz=jQuery(this).attr("href");
if(linkz.indexOf("adclick.g") >= 0)
{
  		jQuery.ajax({
				url: "https://api.khaleejtimes.com/home/decode_url",

processed_data.raw_text: The Greek star is looking to win his first Grand Slam after losing two finals The Greek star is looking to win his first Grand Slam after losing two finals Djokovic's main focus has been to win a men's record 23rd Grand Slam title next weekend in Paris The Ukrainian defeated Daria Kasatkina and opted not to shake hands with the Russian in protest against the war in Ukraine The Serbian is currently tied with Spain's Rafael Nadal at 22 majors Wimbledon champion Rybakina, who has battled pollen allergies in the past, was forced to pull out of French Open due to viral illness Tennis ace says she first met Arthur Borges during a walk to Central Park in New York Pegula's defeat means that four of the top 10 women's seeds have already been knocked out of Roland Garros Last year's runner-up Casper Ruud turns on the style to quell the challenge of Italian qualifier Giulio Zeppieri 6-3 6-2 4-6 7-5 Djokovic wrote 'Kosovo is the heart of Serbia' on a camera lens on Monday, the same day when 30 NATO peacekeeping troops were hurt in clashes with Serb protesters in the Kosovo town of Zvecan With an eye on the world No 1 spot Aryna Sabalenka fights off a determined challenge from fellow Belarusian Iryna Shymanovich to reach the third round
processed_data.text:
The Greek star is looking to win his first Grand Slam after losing two finals
The Greek star is looking to win his first Grand Slam after losing two finals
Djokovic's main focus has been to win a men's record 23rd Grand Slam title next weekend in Paris
The Ukrainian defeated Daria Kasatkina and opted not to shake hands with the Russian in protest against the war in Ukraine
The Serbian is currently tied with Spain's Rafael Nadal at 22 majors
Wimbledon champion Rybakina, who has battled pollen allergies in the past, was forced to pull out of French Open due to viral illness
Tennis ace says she first met Arthur Borges during a walk to Central Park in New York
Pegula's defeat means that four of the top 10 women's seeds have already been knocked out of Roland Garros
Last year's runner-up Casper Ruud turns on the style to quell the challenge of Italian qualifier Giulio Zeppieri 6-3 6-2 4-6 7-5
Djokovic wrote 'Kosovo is the heart of Serbia' on a camera lens on Monday, the same day when 30 NATO peacekeeping troops were hurt in clashes with Serb protesters in the Kosovo town of Zvecan
With an eye on the world No 1 spot Aryna Sabalenka fights off a determined challenge from fellow Belarusian Iryna Shymanovich to reach the third round

<script>

  document.cookie.match('(^|;)\\s*' + name + '\\s*=\\s*([^;]+)')?.pop() || ''
)

jQuery.noConflict();
jQuery(window).on('load', function() {
var iframe = jQuery("iframe");
console.log(iframe.contents());
/* use simple click */
iframe.contents().find("body").click(function(e) {
  var urlz=jQuery(this).contents().find("a").prop('href');
  		jQuery.ajax({
				url: "https://api.khaleejtimes.com/home/decode_url",
				type: "POST",
				async: false,
				crossDomain: true,
				data: { "url" : urlz},
				 dataType: "jsonp",
    			jsonp: "jsoncallback",
				success:function(result){				  
					utag.link({
						"ad_platform":"AdManager",//Required example: AdManager
						"event_action":"addclick",       //Required
						"event_category":"Paid Ad Click",  //Required example premium
						"event_label":"Google",     //Required example google, facebook   
						"tealium_event":"ad_click",        //Required
						"ad_click_short":""+result.actual_url_2nd+"",
						"ad_click_full":""+result.actual_url+"",	
						"original_ad_link":""+result.clicked_url+""						
					});		
				},
				error:function(xhr,status,error,result){				
				   // alert(status);					
				}
			});	  
});


jQuery("a").click(function(){
var linkz=jQuery(this).attr("href");
if(linkz.indexOf("adclick.g") >= 0)
{
  		jQuery.ajax({
				url: "https://api.khaleejtimes.com/home/decode_url",
				type: "POST",
				async: false,
				crossDomain: true,
				data: { "url" : linkz},
				 dataType: "jsonp",
    			jsonp: "jsoncallback",
				success:function(result){				  
					utag.link({

						"original_ad_link":""+result.clicked_url+""

}
});

  @-webkit-keyframes spin {
    from {-webkit-transform:rotate(0deg);}
    to {-webkit-transform:rotate(360deg);}
  }

  @keyframes spin {
    from {transform:rotate(0deg);}
    to {transform:rotate(360deg);}
  }
  .loader {
    display: none;
    position: absolute;
    height: 100%;
    width: 100%;
    top: 0;
    background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.7);
    z-index: 1000;
  }
  .loader::after {
    content:'';
    display:block;
    position:absolute;
    left:48%;top:40%;
    width:40px;height:40px;
    border-style:solid;
    border-color:black;
    border-top-color:transparent;
    border-width: 4px;
    border-radius:50%;
    -webkit-animation: spin .8s linear infinite;
    animation: spin .8s linear infinite;
  }
  .movie-language { display: block !important; }

In the Indian interbank market, the rupee opened at 73.48 against the dollar, then fell to 73.65. Foreign institutional investors were net sellers in the capital market on Monday. Rupee trades at 19.90 versus the UAE dirham on Monday morning. Rupee strengthens to 73.02 against the US dollar. 'The rupee has been gaining on bountiful corporate inflows' The dollar index was down 0.07 per cent at 92.62. Spot gold fell 0.48 per cent to $1,778.88 per ounce by 9.20 am UAE time. Foreign institutional investors were net sellers in the capital market on Monday.
Rupee trades at 19.90 versus the UAE dirham on Monday morning.
Rupee strengthens to 73.02 against the US dollar.
'The rupee has been gaining on bountiful corporate inflows'
The dollar index was down 0.07 per cent at 92.62.
Spot gold fell 0.48 per cent to $1,778.88 per ounce by 9.20 am UAE time.
At the Indian interbank market, the rupee opened strong at 74.30 against the dollar.
The rupee was trading at 20.23 versus UAE dirham on Tuesday morning.

            var NCS_isha_time    = new Date(NSC_pt_cy,(NSC_pt_cm+1),NSC_pt_cd,"20","36",NSC_pt_cs); //24 Hour Based

    <script>
      var MS_PER_MINUTE = 60000;
      var durationInMinutes = 0;
      var navigaNewPrayerTime = new Date();

      
      
      
      

      var prayerNames = new Array("fajr", "shuruq", "dhuhr", "asr", "magrib", "isha");
      var prayerNameTimes = new Array(NCS_fajar_timeRight, NCS_shuruq_timeRight, NCS_duhar_timeRight, NCS_asr_timeRight, NCS_maghrib_timeRight, NCS_isha_timeRight);
      for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
        var navigaNewPrayerTime = new Date(prayerNameTimes[i].getTime() + durationInMinutes * MS_PER_MINUTE);

        var navigaNewPrayerTime_hh = navigaNewPrayerTime.getHours();
        var navigaNewPrayerTime_mm = navigaNewPrayerTime.getMinutes();

        if (navigaNewPrayerTime_hh < 10) {
          navigaNewPrayerTime_hh="0"+navigaNewPrayerTime_hh;
        }
        if (navigaNewPrayerTime_mm < 10) {
          navigaNewPrayerTime_mm="0"+navigaNewPrayerTime_mm;
        }

        document.getElementById("nav_pt_calculate_" +prayerNames[i]).innerHTML = navigaNewPrayerTime_hh + ':' + navigaNewPrayerTime_mm;
      }
    </script>

  <div class="col-12">
    <div class="definition">
      <h4>Muslim prayers: Salah timings, Adhan and rakat</h4>
      <p><b>Salah</b></p>
      <p>
        Salah, meaning ‘prayer’ or ‘supplication’, is also known as Namaz among non-Arab Muslims.
        Salah is one of the five pillars of Islam, which form the core beliefs and practices of the religion.
        The five pillars are:
      </p>
      <ul>
        <li>Profession of faith (Shahada). There is no God but Allah, and Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is the messenger of God.</li>
        <li>Prayer (Salah)</li>
        <li>Charity (Zakat)</li>
        <li>Fasting (Sawm)</li>
        <li>Pilgrimage (Haj)</li>
      </ul>
      <p>
        Salah is obligatory for adult Muslims and prayer times are set according
        to the movement of the Sun and performed five times a day as follows:
      </p>
      <ul>
        <li>Fajr: Dawn, before sunrise</li>
        <li>Dhuhr: Midday, after the Sun passes its highest poin</li>
        <li>Asr: The late part of the afternoon</li>
        <li>Maghrib: Just after sunset</li>
        <li>Isha: Between sunset and midnight</li>
      </ul>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Praying in the masjid</h4>
      <p>
        Muslims can pray anywhere. However, many Muslims pray in congregation in a masjid. 
        A masjid is a place of worship for Muslims. 
        Praying together in a congregation helps Muslims realise that all humanity is one and all are equal under the eyes of God.
      </p>
      <img src="https://static.khaleejtimes.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2021/03/23174746/Salah-Rakats-.jpeg" class="img-fluid" />

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Jumuah</h4>
      <p>
        Apart from the five daily prayers, there is an obligatory Friday (Jumuah) prayer. 
        This prayer is offered in a congregation with a sermon on Fridays, in place of the noon prayer.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Adhan: A call to prayer</h4>
      <p>
        The public call to prayer is called Adhan. The Adhan is delivered from the masjid by a muezzin, 
        who is the masjid's designated caller of prayer. During the call to prayer, 
        the muezzin recites the following Takbir (glorification of God) "Allahu akbar", 
        which translates as "Allah is great".
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">The full call to prayer is as follows:</h4>
      <p>
        Allahu Akbar (God is great)<br />
        Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah (I bear witness that there is no God except the One God)<br />
        Ashadu anna Muhammadar Rasool Allah (I bear witness that Muhammad is the messenger of God)<br />
        Hayya' ala-s-Salah (Hurry to the prayer, or rise up for prayer)<br />
        Hayya' ala-l-Falah (Hurry to success, or rise up for salvation)<br />
        Assalatu khairum-minan-naum (Prayer is better than sleep. This is only recited for the morning prayer.)<br />
        Allahu Akbar (God is Great)<br />
        La ilaha illallah (There is no God except the One God)
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">What is the significance of the Adhan?</h4>
      <p>
        The Adhan is delivered five times a day to invite Muslims to perform obligatory prayers. 
        It is common to hear the call to prayer in public in countries with significant Muslim population. 
        The Adhan is usually recited from the minaret of masjids and 
        is usually delivered facing towards the Holy Kaaba in Makkah.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Performing wudu before salah</h4>

      <p>Wudu is ablution or an act of washing the body before performing prayers or the recitation of the Holy Quran.</p>
      <p>
        For a step by step guide on performing wudu, have a 
        <a href="https://www.khaleejtimes.com/uae/dubai/ramadan-2020-in-dubai-uae-all-you-need-to-know-about-the-holy-month">look at here.</a>
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Rakats in Salah</h4>
      <p>
        A rakat consists of the recommended movements and recitation of verses of the Holy Quran 
        practiced by Muslims while offering prayers to Allah. 
        It also refers to a single unit of Islamic prayers.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Fajr</h4>
      <p>
        Fajr salah should be performed in the last part of the night and before sunrise. 
        Fajr salah consists of two obligatory rakats, known as Fard.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Dhuhr</h4>
      <p>
        Dhuhr salah is the second prayer of the day and is offered at noon. 
        This prayer comprises four obligatory rakats.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Asr</h4>
      <p>
        Asar salah is performed in the afternoon after the Dhuhr prayer. 
        This prayer comprises four obligatory rakats.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Maghrib</h4>
      <p>
        Maghrib salah should be offered at sunset. 
        Magrib salah consists of three obligatory rakats.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">Isha</h4>
      <p>
        The fifth prayer of the day is the Isha salah. 
        It includes four obligatory rakats.
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">There are also other prayers along with these five compulsory prayers:</h4>
      <p>
        Jumuah prayer (offered on Fridays at noon). <br />
        Tahjjud prayer (offered in the early hours of the morning. However, it is not compulsory).<br />
        Tarawih prayer (offered with the Isha prayer and only takes place during the holy month of Ramadan).<br />
        Eid prayers (offered on Eid Al Fitr and Eid Al Adha).
      </p>

      <h4 class="font-weight-bold">The benefits of different positions while performing salah:</h4>
      <p>
        There are various positions while performing salah, which include Qiyam, Ruku, Sajdah and Tashshhud. 
        There are numerous benefits in these actions such as:
      </p>
      <ol>
        <li>
          Qiyam (standing): It ensures proper blood flow to the lower portion of the body, strengthening the leg muscles.
        </li>
        <li>
          Ruku (bowing): This posture is good for the lower vertebral column. 
          It relieves and prevents back pain. It involves stretching of elbows, wrists, knees and ankles, 
          thus developing flexibility around all these areas of the body.
        </li>
        <li>
          Sajdah (prostration): The act of low bowing or prostration to God towards the qiblah. 
          Sajdah maintains blood flow to the brain and stimulates the pituitary gland and pineal gland.
        </li>
        <li>
          Tashahhud (sitting posture): The posture is similar to the Vajrasana, a significant Yoga position. 
          The position is said to strengthen the thigh and calf muscles, improve digestion, 
          and keep the spine straight and erect.
        </li>
      </ol>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

8:43 PM  30  Friday  12  Thul-Hijjah  4:02 AM  5:28 AM  12:25 PM  3:46 PM  7:16 PM  8:43 PM  Muslim prayers: Salah timings, Adhan and rakat  Salah  Salah, meaning ‘prayer’ or ‘supplication’, is also known as Namaz among non-Arab Muslims. Salah is one of the five pillars of Islam, which form the core beliefs and practices of the religion. The five pillars are:  Profession of faith (Shahada). There is no God but Allah, and Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is the messenger of God. Prayer (Salah) Charity (Zakat) Fasting (Sawm) Pilgrimage (Haj) Salah is obligatory for adult Muslims and prayer times are set according to the movement of the Sun and performed five times a day as follows:  Fajr: Dawn, before sunrise Dhuhr: Midday, after the Sun passes its highest poin Asr: The late part of the afternoon Maghrib: Just after sunset Isha: Between sunset and midnight Praying in the masjid  Muslims can pray anywhere. However, many Muslims pray in congregation in a masjid. A masjid is a place of worship for Muslims. Praying together in a congregation helps Muslims realise that all humanity is one and all are equal under the eyes of God.  Jumuah  Apart from the five daily prayers, there is an obligatory Friday (Jumuah) prayer. This prayer is offered in a congregation with a sermon on Fridays, in place of the noon prayer.  Adhan: A call to prayer  The public call to prayer is called Adhan. The Adhan is delivered from the masjid by a muezzin, who is the masjid's designated caller of prayer. During the call to prayer, the muezzin recites the following Takbir (glorification of God) "Allahu akbar", which translates as "Allah is great".  The full call to prayer is as follows:  
        Allahu Akbar (God is great) Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah (I bear witness that there is no God except the One God) Ashadu anna Muhammadar Rasool Allah (I bear witness that Muhammad is the messenger of God) Hayya' ala-s-Salah (Hurry to the prayer, or rise up for prayer) Hayya' ala-l-Falah (Hurry to success, or rise up for salvation) Assalatu khairum-minan-naum (Prayer is better than sleep. This is only recited for the morning prayer.) Allahu Akbar (God is Great) La ilaha illallah (There is no God except the One God) What is the significance of the Adhan?  The Adhan is delivered five times a day to invite Muslims to perform obligatory prayers. It is common to hear the call to prayer in public in countries with significant Muslim population. The Adhan is usually recited from the minaret of masjids and is usually delivered facing towards the Holy Kaaba in Makkah.  Performing wudu before salah  Wudu is ablution or an act of washing the body before performing prayers or the recitation of the Holy Quran.  
        For a step by step guide on performing wudu, have a 
         look at here. 
       Rakats in Salah  A rakat consists of the recommended movements and recitation of verses of the Holy Quran practiced by Muslims while offering prayers to Allah. It also refers to a single unit of Islamic prayers.  Fajr  Fajr salah should be performed in the last part of the night and before sunrise. Fajr salah consists of two obligatory rakats, known as Fard.  Dhuhr  Dhuhr salah is the second prayer of the day and is offered at noon. This prayer comprises four obligatory rakats.  Asr  Asar salah is performed in the afternoon after the Dhuhr prayer. This prayer comprises four obligatory rakats.  Maghrib  Maghrib salah should be offered at sunset. Magrib salah consists of three obligatory rakats.  Isha  The fifth prayer of the day is the Isha salah. It includes four obligatory rakats.  There are also other prayers along with these five compulsory prayers:  
        Jumuah prayer (offered on Fridays at noon).  Tahjjud prayer (offered in the early hours of the morning. However, it is not compulsory). Tarawih prayer (offered with the Isha prayer and only takes place during the holy month of Ramadan). Eid prayers (offered on Eid Al Fitr and Eid Al Adha). The benefits of different positions while performing salah:  There are various positions while performing salah, which include Qiyam, Ruku, Sajdah and Tashshhud. There are numerous benefits in these actions such as:  Qiyam (standing): It ensures proper blood flow to the lower portion of the body, strengthening the leg muscles. Ruku (bowing): This posture is good for the lower vertebral column. It relieves and prevents back pain. It involves stretching of elbows, wrists, knees and ankles, thus developing flexibility around all these areas of the body. Sajdah (prostration): The act of low bowing or prostration to God towards the qiblah. Sajdah maintains blood flow to the brain and stimulates the pituitary gland and pineal gland. Tashahhud (sitting posture): The posture is similar to the Vajrasana, a significant Yoga position. The position is said to strengthen the thigh and calf muscles, improve digestion, and keep the spine straight and erect. Sign Up For Breaking News Alerts Be in the know. Get the latest breaking news delivered straight to your inbox.

Muslim prayers: Salah timings, Adhan and rakat
Salah
Salah, meaning ‘prayer’ or ‘supplication’, is also known as Namaz among non-Arab Muslims. Salah is one of the five pillars of Islam, which form the core beliefs and practices of the religion. The five pillars are:
- Profession of faith (Shahada). There is no God but Allah, and Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is the messenger of God.
- Prayer (Salah)
- Charity (Zakat)
- Fasting (Sawm)
- Pilgrimage (Haj)
Salah is obligatory for adult Muslims and prayer times are set according to the movement of the Sun and performed five times a day as follows:
- Fajr: Dawn, before sunrise
- Dhuhr: Midday, after the Sun passes its highest poin
- Asr: The late part of the afternoon
- Maghrib: Just after sunset
- Isha: Between sunset and midnight
Praying in the masjid
Muslims can pray anywhere. However, many Muslims pray in congregation in a masjid. A masjid is a place of worship for Muslims. Praying together in a congregation helps Muslims realise that all humanity is one and all are equal under the eyes of God.
![](https://static.khaleejtimes.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2021/03/23174746/Salah-Rakats-.jpeg)
Jumuah
Apart from the five daily prayers, there is an obligatory Friday (Jumuah) prayer. This prayer is offered in a congregation with a sermon on Fridays, in place of the noon prayer.
Adhan: A call to prayer
The public call to prayer is called Adhan. The Adhan is delivered from the masjid by a muezzin, who is the masjid's designated caller of prayer. During the call to prayer, the muezzin recites the following Takbir (glorification of God) "Allahu akbar", which translates as "Allah is great".
The full call to prayer is as follows:
Allahu Akbar (God is great)
Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah (I bear witness that there is no God except the One God)
Ashadu anna Muhammadar Rasool Allah (I bear witness that Muhammad is the messenger of God)
Hayya' ala-s-Salah (Hurry to the prayer, or rise up for prayer)
Hayya' ala-l-Falah (Hurry to success, or rise up for salvation)
Assalatu khairum-minan-naum (Prayer is better than sleep. This is only recited for the morning prayer.)
Allahu Akbar (God is Great)
La ilaha illallah (There is no God except the One God)
What is the significance of the Adhan?
The Adhan is delivered five times a day to invite Muslims to perform obligatory prayers. It is common to hear the call to prayer in public in countries with significant Muslim population. The Adhan is usually recited from the minaret of masjids and is usually delivered facing towards the Holy Kaaba in Makkah.
Performing wudu before salah
Wudu is ablution or an act of washing the body before performing prayers or the recitation of the Holy Quran.
For a step by step guide on performing wudu, have a
[look at here.](https://www.khaleejtimes.com/uae/dubai/ramadan-2020-in-dubai-uae-all-you-need-to-know-about-the-holy-month)
Rakats in Salah
A rakat consists of the recommended movements and recitation of verses of the Holy Quran practiced by Muslims while offering prayers to Allah. It also refers to a single unit of Islamic prayers.
Fajr
Fajr salah should be performed in the last part of the night and before sunrise. Fajr salah consists of two obligatory rakats, known as Fard.
Dhuhr
Dhuhr salah is the second prayer of the day and is offered at noon. This prayer comprises four obligatory rakats.
Asr
Asar salah is performed in the afternoon after the Dhuhr prayer. This prayer comprises four obligatory rakats.
Maghrib
Maghrib salah should be offered at sunset. Magrib salah consists of three obligatory rakats.
Isha
The fifth prayer of the day is the Isha salah. It includes four obligatory rakats.
There are also other prayers along with these five compulsory prayers:
Jumuah prayer (offered on Fridays at noon).
Tahjjud prayer (offered in the early hours of the morning. However, it is not compulsory).
Tarawih prayer (offered with the Isha prayer and only takes place during the holy month of Ramadan).
Eid prayers (offered on Eid Al Fitr and Eid Al Adha).
The benefits of different positions while performing salah:
There are various positions while performing salah, which include Qiyam, Ruku, Sajdah and Tashshhud. There are numerous benefits in these actions such as:
- Qiyam (standing): It ensures proper blood flow to the lower portion of the body, strengthening the leg muscles.
- Ruku (bowing): This posture is good for the lower vertebral column. It relieves and prevents back pain. It involves stretching of elbows, wrists, knees and ankles, thus developing flexibility around all these areas of the body.
- Sajdah (prostration): The act of low bowing or prostration to God towards the qiblah. Sajdah maintains blood flow to the brain and stimulates the pituitary gland and pineal gland.
- Tashahhud (sitting posture): The posture is similar to the Vajrasana, a significant Yoga position. The position is said to strengthen the thigh and calf muscles, improve digestion, and keep the spine straight and erect.

Be in the know. Get the latest breaking news delivered straight to your inbox.

<script>
const getCookieValue = (name) => (
  document.cookie.match('(^|;)\\s*' + name + '\\s*=\\s*([^;]+)')?.pop() || ''
)
	
/*
	if(getCookieValue('user_sessions')%2==0)
	{    
	document.cookie = "user_sessions=1;path=/";	
	
	}
	else
	{
		var valuez=getCookieValue('user_sessions');
		if(!valuez)
		{		
		valuez=0;
		}
		value=Number(valuez)+1;
		document.cookie = "user_sessions="+ value+";path=/";
		
	}
*/

jQuery.noConflict();
jQuery(window).on('load', function() {
var iframe = jQuery("iframe");
console.log(iframe.contents());
/* use simple click */
iframe.contents().find("body").click(function(e) {
  var urlz=jQuery(this).contents().find("a").prop('href');
  		jQuery.ajax({
				url: "https://api.khaleejtimes.com/home/decode_url",
				type: "POST",
				async: false,
				crossDomain: true,
				data: { "url" : urlz},
				 dataType: "jsonp",
    			jsonp: "jsoncallback",
				success:function(result){				  
					utag.link({
						"ad_platform":"AdManager",//Required example: AdManager
						"event_action":"addclick",       //Required
						"event_category":"Paid Ad Click",  //Required example premium
						"event_label":"Google",     //Required example google, facebook   
						"tealium_event":"ad_click",        //Required
						"ad_click_short":""+result.actual_url_2nd+"",

  jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
    $('.ew-latest-content-filter').on('change', function(e) {
      var container = $(this).closest('.ew-latest-content-container');
      var filter = container.find('.ew-latest-content-filter-container');
      var loader = container.find('.loader');
      var content = container.find('.ew-latest-content-articles');
      var data = filter.find('select, input').serializeArray();
      data.push({name: 'action', value: 'filter_latest_content'});
      jQuery.ajax({
        url: '/ajax.php',
        // url: infomaker.ajaxurl,
        type: 'POST',
        data: data,
        dataType: 'JSON',
        beforeSend: function() {
          loader.show();
        },
        complete: function(){
          loader.hide();
        },
        success: function(response) {
          content.html(response.html);
          lazyLoadInstance.update();
        }
      });
    });
